poem:
Title: "As Dawn Renews the Soul"

Behold, the play of life stirs, cicadas hum 
On a stage set by time, every 17 years reborn.
In darkness, they conjure tales from the past's drum,
A primordial silence flecked with sound, just as morn.
Echoing behind the mask of theater, our roots thrive,
Unsettling, yet tragicomic, this naked dance of life,
Sarah performs, blazing a path from the unforgiving hive.
